definition: to agree by chance (idiom); taking the same action without prior consultation
to make an appointment/to invite/approximately/pact/treaty/to economize/to restrict/to reduce (a fraction)/concise
to weigh in a balance or on a scale
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)

sentences.english: The papers chorused the praises of the positive suggestions of the government.
sentences.chinese: 各大报纸不约而同地颂扬政府积极性的建议。

sentences.english: They all raised the question as if by prior agreement.
sentences.chinese: 他们都不约而同地提出了这个问题。

sentences.english: Every newspaper invariably speaks highly to the suggestion put forward by the government.
sentences.chinese: 各大报纸不约而同地颂扬政府积极性的建议。

sentences.english: Five feet apart they paused as if by mutual consent .
sentences.chinese: 相隔五步路，大家就不约而同的站住脚跟。

sentences.english: This answer came derisively from several places at the same instant.
sentences.chinese: 好几个人都不约而同地以讥讽的口吻作出回答。

sentences.english: Qiao Zhen and Xiang Feng encourage him to quit teaching.
sentences.chinese: 巧珍和向风等不约而同帮他准备了辞职信。

sentences.english: When turning toward the west, they both turned their heads to look left as if by a prior agreement vacantly.
sentences.chinese: 向西拐弯的时候，两人不约而同地向左转头看了看。

sentences.english: The Indian teachers and students present were all amazed by Premier Wen's deep understanding of the Chinese calligraphy.
sentences.chinese: 这时，全场的印度师生们不约而同地发出赞叹声。

sentences.english: The four exclaimed in unison, with an awestruck look on their faces.
sentences.chinese: 那四人不约而同的大声惊呼，脸露敬畏之色。

sentences.english: The invention of baked earthenware craft and the creation of ancient Chinese Characters were almost simultaneous.
sentences.chinese: 烧陶工艺的发明和古文字的产生几乎是不约而同的。

sentences.english: Of one accord, they went out of their room to enjoy the warmth of the sun.
sentences.chinese: 他俩不约而同地走出房间去享受那温暖的阳光。

sentences.english: Lee doesn't raise in no time to come in from the doorway, public all without before arrangement stood to keep body.
sentences.chinese: 李不举匆匆从门口进来，众人不约而同都站直了身子。

sentences.english: They moved to the United States at different times in the late 1960s.
sentences.chinese: 他们在1960年代末期不约而同地来到美国。

sentences.english: The papers all chorused the praises of the positive suggestions of the government.
sentences.chinese: 各报不约而同地颂扬政府积极地建议。

sentences.english: All major newspapers praised without previous arrangment the motivated suggestion from the government.
sentences.chinese: 各大报纸不约而同地颂扬政府积极性的建议。

sentences.english: Simultaneously we looked to the silver rim of the moon.
sentences.chinese: 我们不约而同地看向月亮的银边。

definition: different mouths, same voice/to speak in unison (idiom)
to look at each other in dismay (idiom)
